title: Synchronizing MSSQL DB results in reassigning constraints in tables
body:
**Issue type:**

[ ] question
[x] bug report
[ ] feature request
[ ] documentation issue

**Database system/driver:**

[ ] `cordova`
[ ] `mongodb`
[x] `mssql`
[ ] `mysql` / `mariadb`
[ ] `oracle`
[ ] `postgres`
[ ] `sqlite`
[ ] `sqljs`
[ ] `react-native`
[ ] `expo`

**TypeORM version:**

[x] `latest`
[ ] `@next`
[ ] `0.x.x` (or put your version here)

When I turn synchronize on, table gets created the first time, but second initialization of app results in following error:

> QueryFailedError: Error: Could not create constraint or index. See previous errors.
at new QueryFailedError (D:\Projects\Project\Codebase\master\Project.Api\src\error\QueryFailedError.ts:7:9)
at D:\Projects\Project\Codebase\master\Project.Api\src\driver\sqlserver\SqlServerQueryRunner.ts:209:37
at _query (D:\Projects\Project\Codebase\master\Project.Api\node_modules\mssql\lib\base.js:1253:25)
at Request.tds.Request.err [as userCallback] (D:\Projects\Project\Codebase\master\Project.Api\node_modules\mssql\lib\tedious.js:620:15)
at Request._this.callback (D:\Projects\Project\Codebase\master\Project.Api\node_modules\tedious\lib\request.js:60:27)
at Connection.endOfMessageMarkerReceived (D:\Projects\Project\Codebase\master\Project.Api\node_modules\tedious\lib\connection.js:1906:20)
at Connection.dispatchEvent (D:\Projects\Project\Codebase\master\Project.Api\node_modules\tedious\lib\connection.js:992:38)
at Parser. (D:\Projects\Project\Codebase\master\Project.Api\node_modules\tedious\lib\connection.js:813:18)
at emitOne (events.js:116:13)
at Parser.emit (events.js:211:7)

I investigated this issue by using MSSQL Profiler. It logged following alter queries being fired on it:

`exec sp_executesql @statement=N'ALTER TABLE "LogFileUpload" ALTER COLUMN "UploadDate" datetime'`

`exec sp_executesql @statement=N'ALTER TABLE "LogFileUpload" ADD CONSTRAINT "DF_fd73f87f20931690c7e1a099bdf" DEFAULT GETDATE() FOR "UploadDate"'`

The schema of table LogFileUpload already defines "UploadDate" column of "datetime" type. But still it alters this table to add this column. Secondly it adds a constraint of "DEFAULT GETDATE()" for it. This constraint is already defined on the table, therefore SQL Server is throwing following error:

> Msg 1781, Level 16, State 1, Line 1
> Column already has a DEFAULT bound to it.
> Msg 1750, Level 16, State 0, Line 1
> Could not create constraint or index. See previous errors.

I also referred this issue: https://github.com/typeorm/typeorm/issues/1991. Nothing helped.
Please help me solve this issue.
